articles.title: White Paper on Human Rights Situation in U.S. in 2016
articles.content:
White Paper on Human Rights Situation in U.S. in 2016
Pyongyang, March 15 (KCNA) -- The DPRK Institute of International Studies Wednesday released a "white paper on human rights situation in the U.S. in 2016".
					 According to the white paper, the U.S. presidential election in 2016 was recorded as squandering the largest sum of money in history.
					
					 About USD 5 billion was consumed in the presidential election in 2008 and USD 6 billion in 2012, whereas in the last presidential election it amounted to USD 10 billion. Advertisement for the presidential candidates cost USD 4.4 billion, and the earnings by websites, radio stations and newspapers for political advertisement amounted to USD 1.2 billion, USD 916 million and USD 882 million, respectively.
					
					 The turnout for the last presidential and general elections was 60% and 30~40%, respectively.
					
					 Terming the U.S. a human rights desert where even elementary human rights are not provided, the white paper said:
					
					 In the U.S., in one week of December 2016, 275,000 persons joined the chronic contingent of the unemployed numbering 7.9 million; 18.8% of the total number of the unemployed was young people.
					
					 Last year the number of persons without shelter exceeded 560,000, and 322,000 persons in 17 northern counties in Florida are maintaining a bare existence with the help of "charitable organizations."
					
					 According to the statistics made public by economists jointly in the end of 2016, the average annual income of the wealthy people accounting for 1% of the total population was 81 times that of those under the middle class, a considerable increase from 27 times 36 years ago.
					
					 Over the past 25 years, school expenses skyrocketed to 440%. About 6 million young people less than 24 years old do not think about going to school and 1.2 million high-school students give up further studies every year because of the exorbitant school expenses.
					
					 The situation of medical service in the U.S. is a graphic testimony to the system's anti-human nature. 
					
					 It costs USD 500 to have a tooth pulled out, tens of thousands of dollars for appendectomy, USD 1 000 for a day in hospital for first aid, and USD 100,000~200,000 for an operation on the emergency case in the first-aid room.
					
					 The "health insurance" has become a legal tool for emptying the people's purses.
					
					 The Department of Justice made public that from the end of June 2016 management personnel of medical organs and doctors numbering 301 were prosecuted on suspicion of health insurance fraud.
					
					 Though women occupy 57% of the workforce, their salary is 81% of that of their male counterparts, and it is 69% and 58% for the Afro-American and Hispanic women. 
					
					 About 6 million women fall victim to violent crimes every year.
					
					 A UPI dispatch disclosed that the cases of human trafficking in 2016 increased by 35.7% compared to the previous year.
					
					 Noting that 2016 was a blood-soaked year ridden with cases of gun-related crimes in the U.S., the white paper disclosed that more than 58,120 cases of gun violence took place nationwide, claiming 15,039 lives and injuring 30,589.
					
					 On the U.S. institutional discrimination aimed at obliterating other races, it said:
					
					 According to a report by the Expert Group on African Descendents of the UN Human Rights Council, 40.4% of the homeless in the U.S. are Afro-Americans and their unemployment rate is double that of the whites'. And as for the same offences, the imprisonment rate of black men is 5.9 times higher than that of white men and the rate of black women, 2.1 times higher than white women.
					
					 Most of the 256 people who fell victim to police shootings in the first three months of last year were black.
					
					 The above-mentioned violations of human rights in the U.S. are the tip of the iceberg, and they are by no means accidents that were witnessed in 2016 alone.
					
					 These criminal offenses, which run counter to human dignity and intelligence, are the inevitable outcome of the American-style "democracy" and the U.S. social system based on the law of the jungle and extreme individualism.
					
					 The U.S. is loud in its advocacy of "universal respect for human rights," publishing "annual reports" that deal with the human rights situations in other countries. However, it can never cover up nor negate its own human rights situation that has been the subject of international criticism and condemnation.

articles.title: Workers and Members of GFTUK Meet
articles.content:
Workers and Members of GFTUK Meet
Pyongyang, March 15 (KCNA) -- Workers and members of the General Federation of Trade Unions of Korea (GFTUK) met at the Central Hall of Workers Wednesday to vow to glorify the Conference of Mallima Frontrunners as one of victors.
					 The appeal, made by the creators of the Spirit of Kangwon Province to the working people across the country, was read out before speeches at the meeting.
					
					 The speakers stressed the need to honor the national economy plans ahead of the schedule through a dynamic drive for increased production and creation while waging an all-out charge for building an economic power and improving the standard of people's living.
					
					 They called for successfully undertaking any project true to the Party's plan for building the capital city and conducting a dynamic mass technical innovation movement for the home production of various kinds of building materials.
					
					 They also expressed the will to further round off the Korean-style iron-production process and ensure the timely supply of iron and steel needed for major projects.
					
					 And they declared that they would transport more materials necessary for building a powerful socialist country.
					
					 Meanwhile, similar meetings were held at different units in the field of science and technology and major industries to respond to the appeal.

articles.title: Posters Celebrating Birth Anniversary of Kim Il Sung Produced
articles.content:
Posters Celebrating Birth Anniversary of Kim Il Sung Produced
Pyongyang, March 15 (KCNA) -- The Workers' Party of Korea Publishing House produced posters celebrating the 105th birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung.
					 Given in relief in their upper parts are letters "105th birth anniversary of the great leader Comrade Kim Il Sung." The posters depict Kim Il Sung's old home in Mangyongdae, Mangyong Hill and Kimilsungia inside the sun. They have letters "The Day of the Sun" and "Celebration."

articles.title: DPRK Soccer Team Defeats Mongolian Team
articles.content:
DPRK Soccer Team Defeats Mongolian Team
Pyongyang, March 15 (KCNA) -- There has begun the soccer matches of the Group I of the 2017 AFC Cup.
					 The April 25 team, the Kigwancha team of the DPRK and the Mongolian Erchim team of the group are to have the home and away matches on the basis of league match from Mar. 14 to May 31 and the successful team is to advance to the next matches.
					
					 The April 25 team beat the Erchim team 6:0 in a soccer match at the May Day Stadium on Tuesday.
					
					 The matches continue.

articles.title: April 25 Team Makes Good Start in AFC Cup
articles.content:
April 25 Team Makes Good Start in AFC Cup
Pyongyang, March 15 (KCNA) -- There took place the first soccer match between the April 25 Team of the DPRK and the Mongolian Erchim Team, which belong to Group I in the 2017 AFC Cup, at the May Day Stadium in Pyongyang on Tuesday.
					 The April 25 team overpowered its rival 6:0 in its home ground. It opened the score at around 11th minute with a header by forward Kim Yu Song, who made a hat trick in about 23 minutes.
					
					 Kim headed the ball into the net again at around 30th minute and scored the fifth goal at around 57th minute.
					
					 At around 76th minute, the ball was shot into the net by Om Chol Song.
					
					 After the match, Battulga Zorigt, chief coach of the Erchim Team, in an interview told that his team gained good experience through the match and the April 25 team is strong in attack and defense.
					
					 Kwon Ryong Jun, coach of the April 25 Team, said that his team would do its best for better results in the upcoming matches.
					
					 The second match between the two teams will be held in Mongolia on May 17.

articles.title: National Archives Bureau Marks Its 70th Birthday
articles.content:
National Archives Bureau Marks Its 70th Birthday
Pyongyang, March 15 (KCNA) -- The National Archives Bureau marked its 70th birthday with due ceremony on Wednesday.
					 President Kim Il Sung founded the first national archives institution on March 11, Juche 36 (1947).
					
					 He made sure that data on the army and people's struggle and archives were safely preserved during the Fatherland Liberation War and wisely led the workers in the field of preservation of archives to fulfill their mission and duty, keeping pace with the socialist construction gaining in depth in the post-war period.
					
					 Leader Kim Jong Il indicated the orientation and ways to develop the work for preserving archives on a legal basis, noting that the work for preserving state archives is an important job to collect and arrange successes achieved in the revolution and construction and data on the struggle of the popular masses and convey them to posterity.
					
					 Respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un gave a series of instructions to further improve the work of the State Archives Bureau as required by the developing revolution.

articles.title: Nanotechnology Products Conducive to Agricultural Development
articles.content:
Nanotechnology Products Conducive to Agricultural Development
Pyongyang, March 15 (KCNA) -- Scientists of the Agricultural Nano Technology Institute under the Institute of Agricultural Science in the DPRK recently developed nanotechnology products for increased agricultural production.
					 Among them are nano growth stimulator, nano-silicon fertilizer and nano photosynthetic accelerant.
					
					 The nano growth stimulator powered by solar energy has an effect of changing the property of water by scattering special electromagnetic wave. It promotes the germination of rice seed and steps up the activity of enzymes like amylase, protease and catalase, thus increasing rice output per hectare.
					
					 The nano silicon fertilizer is a mixture of nano materials absorbing far-infrared rays and nano silicon. It helps strengthen resistance to harmful insects and increase the yield by fostering photosynthetic ability.
					
					 And it prevents rice from excessive absorption of salt and transpiration in tideland-turned fields.

articles.title: Machines in Wide Use for Sapling Production
articles.content:
Machines in Wide Use for Sapling Production
Pyongyang, March 15 (KCNA) -- Newly developed machines have been widely used for sapling production in the DPRK.
					 In this regard, Kim Ho Yong, director of the Forest Institute under the Ministry of Land and Environment Protection, told KCNA:
					
					 The machines made with indigenous technology and efforts have been introduced into production at tree nurseries.
					
					 Among those machines are root-cutter, sapling-digger, ridging machine, seed-processing machine and mounted drill.
					
					 The root cutter is capable of severing roots from saplings in several hectares on a daily average, while the sapling-digger can do the work of ten men a day.
					
					 The seed-processing machine helps raise germination rate than ever before and the mounted drill makes it possible to save a great deal of labor in sowing.

articles.title: 59th Graduation Ceremony of Korean University of Chongryon Held
articles.content:
59th Graduation Ceremony of Korean University of Chongryon Held
Pyongyang, March 15 (KCNA) -- The 59th graduation ceremony of Korean University of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon) took place at the hall of the university in Tokyo on Mar. 12.
					 It was attended by Ho Jong Man, chairman of the Central Standing Committee of Chongryon, etc. and the graduates and their parents, teachers, students and Korean residents.
					
					 Congratulatory messages from the Education Commission of the DPRK and institutions of Chongryon were read out at the ceremony.
					
					 Ho in his congratulatory speech said that it is the honorable duty of the graduates to invariably carry forward the brilliant traditions of patriotism.
					
					 He hoped that the graduates would live up to the expectations of the organizations of Chongryon and Korean compatriots in Japan that they would more fully display the might of Chongryon.
					
					 Jang Pyong Thae, rector of the university, made a report.
					
					 Graduates were awarded citations of the Education Commission of the DPRK, the Central Standing Committee of Chongryon and the university and prizes for graduation papers.
					
					 There was a speech on behalf of the graduates.
					
					 A letter to respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un was read out at the ceremony.
					
					 After the ceremony, there took place an art performance of the graduates.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Slams Muscle-flexing of U.S. and S. Korean Warmongers
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Slams Muscle-flexing of U.S. and S. Korean Warmongers
Pyongyang, March 15 (KCNA) -- Key Resolve and Foal Eagle joint military maneuvers of the U.S. and south Korean puppet warmongers are an open declaration of war against the DPRK as they reveal their sinister scenario to launch a nuclear war against it.
					 Rodong Sinmun Wednesday says this in an article.
					
					 It goes on:
					
					 There is no guarantee that the ongoing maneuvers would not lead to an all-out war.
					
					 What is becoming clear is the fact that this saber-rattling is increasing the danger of a nuclear war on the Korean peninsula and in Northeast Asia to an extreme pitch. The U.S. and puppet group of traitors are nuclear war maniacs and heinous peace harassers.
					
					 It is quite senseless that the DPRK should remain a passive onlooker to the alarming development now that they made the start of a nuclear war an established fact and are putting spurs to it.
					
					 As they escalate their moves for aggression and war against the DPRK, it is left with no option but to take a series of toughest measures to foil the hostile forces' provocations with a nuclear treasured sword of justice.
					
					 If the U.S. and south Korean puppet forces fire even a single shell into the inviolable waters, sky and land of the DPRK on which its sovereignty is exercised, the DPRK's Hwasong rockets will reduce the bases of aggression and provocation to such debris that no living thing can be found.
					
					 They had better behave themselves, properly understanding the will of our infuriated service personnel and people to wipe out them.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun on Lesson Taught by Miserable End of Park Geun Hye
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun on Lesson Taught by Miserable End of Park Geun Hye
Pyongyang, March 15 (KCNA) -- The pitiful fate of Park Geun Hye who faced a severe judgment by history and the people teaches a serious lesson along with the miserable end of the successive fascist dictators of south Korea, says Rodong Sinmun Wednesday in an article.
					 It goes on:
					
					 It is the inevitability of history that the group of traitors is fated to go to ruin for perpetrating acts of treachery, depending upon outside forces after betraying the nation, and going against the aspiration and wishes of the people.
					
					 The people's punishment of the group of traitors is severe, merciless and deadly. This is clearly proved by the pitiful end of Park.
					
					 Whoever perpetrates acts of treachery by relying on outside forces with their backs turned on the nation is not only hated and denounced by the people but miserably forsaken by his or her master. This is clearly evidenced by the miserable fate of Park.
					
					 Those who go reckless in fascist suppression and confrontation with compatriots, while reigning over the people, backed by outside forces, are destined to go to ruin. This is their inescapable fate.
					
					 The fate of the puppet conservative group is like fallen leaves after Park is removed from office. Nevertheless, the group is making desperate efforts to seek a way out by more zealously following the outside forces' moves to stifle the DPRK. However, this is as foolish an act as precipitating its own doomsday.

articles.title: DPRK to React to Enemies' Hard-line Policy with Toughest Action: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
DPRK to React to Enemies' Hard-line Policy with Toughest Action: Rodong Sinmun
Pyongyang, March 15 (KCNA) -- The on-going Key Resolve and Foal Eagle joint military drills of the U.S. imperialists and their vassal forces are the largest-ever muscle-flexing to stifle the DPRK, says Rodong Sinmun Wednesday in an article.
					 The article goes on:
					
					 The war rehearsals are of more dangerous nature as they are being staged amid the worst-ever political and economic sanctions and pressure imposed on the DPRK over its measures for bolstering up its nuclear force.
					
					 As the U.S. imperialists and their vassal forces are staging drills for a nuclear war against the DPRK at its doorstep, the DPRK is left with no option but to counter them with toughest actions.
					
					 Greater and stronger nuclear strike capabilities provide stronger muscle for deterring a nuclear war.
					
					 For the DPRK standing in confrontation with the U.S., the chieftain of aggression advocating the doctrine that nukes are all-powerful, its strong nuclear attack capabilities serve as a treasured sword for averting a nuclear war on the Korean peninsula and defusing the danger of war against the Korean nation.
					
					 The power of the nuclear strike means of the DPRK precisely means its national power and dignity.
					
					 No enemy force on earth can escape the powerful strike of the invincible revolutionary Paektusan army equipped with Juche-oriented military idea, strategy and tactics and Juche-based weapons of Korean style.
					
					 The vassal forces involved in the on-going nuclear war drills in support of the U.S. hostile policy toward the DPRK are no exception.

articles.title: Strong Military Power Only Can Ensure Peace: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
Strong Military Power Only Can Ensure Peace: Rodong Sinmun
Pyongyang, March 15 (KCNA) -- Talking only cannot protect peace and the security of a country cannot be begged for. Genuine peace can be preserved only with one's own strong military power. Rodong Sinmun Wednesday says this in an article.
					 It goes on:
					
					 Peace can be achieved and firmly protected only with powerful muscle in the world where the imperialists' highhanded and arbitrary practices, aggression and interference prevail.
					
					 The stronger one's strength grows, the higher one's pride gets and the more durable peace becomes.
					
					 The Korean people feel exceptionally high proud of their matchless military muscle. 
					
					 The armed forces built by the DPRK for protecting peace through a dynamic drive for self-reliance and self-development serve as forces to win justice and victory.
					
					 The wishes of mankind for peace can never be achieved by talking only as long as imperialism exists in the world.
					
					 It is the trite method of the imperialists to mount outrageous military attack if they fail to attain their aggressive goal by political and diplomatic methods. 
					
					 The imperialists disregard both international law and the UN in order to carry out their scenario for aggression and war.
					
					 If a country truly wants and loves peace, it should direct all efforts to bolstering up the capability for self-defence under the unfurled banner of self-development-first principle.

articles.title: Stop to Joint Military Drills Demanded in S. Korea
articles.content:
Stop to Joint Military Drills Demanded in S. Korea
Pyongyang, March 15 (KCNA) -- According to the south Korean online newspaper Tongil News, civic and social organizations of south Korea including the People's Action for Peace against War, the Solidarity for Social Progress and the Workers' Solidarity called a press conference in Seoul on March 13 at which they demanded an immediate stop to the Key Resolve and Foal Eagle joint military maneuvers.
					 They charged that the on-going war rehearsals, which made a preemptive attack on the DPRK an established fact, are seriously disturbing peace as they escalate the danger of war on the Korean peninsula.
					
					 They called for the policy of eliminating the evils left by the Park Geun Hye regime and heading for lasting peace and reunification.

articles.title: S. Korean Air Force Conducts Large-scale Air Strike Drill
articles.content:
S. Korean Air Force Conducts Large-scale Air Strike Drill
Pyongyang, March 15 (KCNA) -- The warmongers of south Korea kicked off a large-scale air strike drill against the DPRK on March 10, according to the south Korean Yonhap News.
					 At least 50 aircraft such as F-15K, KF-16, FA-50, F-4E, F-5, E-737 airborne early warning and control plane, CN-235 transport plane and HH-60 helicopter and huge troops belonging to 15 units of the puppet air force are involved in the drill to be staged till March 17.
					
					 They are planning to stage a large-scale attack formation rehearsal on March 16 on the basis of Kill Chain conception, a preemptive attack system to invade the DPRK.
					
					 They openly claimed that the saber-rattling is aimed at striking major targets of the DPRK.

articles.title: S. Koreans Reject Scheme to Turn Jeju Island into General Military Base
articles.content:
S. Koreans Reject Scheme to Turn Jeju Island into General Military Base
Pyongyang, March 15 (KCNA) -- The Citizens Solidarity for Democratic Society of south Korea in a commentary on March 12 slammed the puppet military's scheme to turn Jeju Island into a general military base.
					 Referring to the scheme to build a new air base on the island, the commentary said what merits attention is that the military is pushing forward the construction of the base in an undemocratic manner, disregard the residents' opinion.
					
					 The residents of the island and other people will never allow the military's dangerous attempt to turn the island into an arsenal, it warned.

articles.title: Nigerian Social Body Introduces Korean Women
articles.content:
Nigerian Social Body Introduces Korean Women
Pyongyang, March 15 (KCNA) -- The Nigerian National Committee for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism posted an article titled "Pride of Korean women" on its website on Mar. 6.
					The article said:
					
					The reality of the DPRK in which the dignity and pride of the Korean women have reached a high level is drawing the world attention on the occasion of the March 8 International Women's Day.
					
					The Korean women are exercising equal rights with the men as proud mistresses of the country and the society.
					
					They are living a worthwhile life, playing important roles in all fabrics of social life including state and economic institutions and science, education, public health and literature and arts.
					
					The rights of the women in the DPRK are guaranteed by law.
					
					The Korean women enjoy great benefits from the state and society, said the article. 
					
					Pyongyang Maternity Hospital is a typical example, it added.
					
					The article introduced in detail the facts that women are projected as patriots, heroines and pace-setters of the era as they fully display their enthusiasm, creative wisdom and talents in the struggle to defend socialism and in major worksites for building an economic power.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Birth Anniversary to Be Marked in Switzerland
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Birth Anniversary to Be Marked in Switzerland
Pyongyang, March 15 (KCNA) -- A Swiss preparatory committee for celebrating the 105th birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung was formed in Basel on Mar. 6.
					 Martin Lotscher, chairman of the Switzerland-Korea Committee, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.
					
					 The committee set the celebration period from Mar. 10 to April 16 and decided to organize colorful political and cultural events praising the exploits performed by the President for liberating Korea, building a new society, achieving national reunification and accomplishing the global cause of independence.

articles.title: Korean Books Introduced in Peru in Praise of Great Men of Mt Paektu
articles.content:
Korean Books Introduced in Peru in Praise of Great Men of Mt Paektu
Pyongyang, March 15 (KCNA) -- A ceremony of introducing Korean books was held at Kim Jong Suk Library in Peru in praise of peerlessly great men of Mt Paektu on Mar. 2 in the run-up to the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung.
					 Displayed at the venue of the event were books "The Answer of the DPRK" and "The DPRK Seen from a New Angle" and collection of poems "A Shining Country in the East" written by Peruvian personages.
					
					 The chairman of the Peruvian preparatory committee for Gathering 2017-Praise to the Great Persons of Mt Paektu said that we know better than others the greatness of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il, leaders of the Korean people, and we are followers of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism and boundlessly revere the great leaders, adding:
					
					 Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il founded and developed in depth the Juche idea, a revolutionary doctrine centered on man, and enforced original Songun politics and thanks to them, the DPRK turned into an independent power, country of single-hearted unity, satellite manufacturer and launcher and nuclear power.
					
					 Today's ceremony will offer an important occasion in giving wide publicity and adding luster to the careers and exploits of the great leaders.
					
					 The president of the Peruvian National Independent Movement for Free Voting's Union, the general secretary of the People's Front of Workers, Peasants and Students of Peru and the secretary general of the Peru-Korea Institute of Culture and Friendship told about what they saw during the visit to the DPRK and what made them write the books.
					
					 They praised Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il as outstanding great men and iron-willed commanders who glorified the era of independence.
					
					 They expressed support and solidarity to the Korean people's struggle for building a socialist power and achieving the country's reunification, saying that the Korean people's experience in building socialism is an example to be learned after by the world revolutionaries and progressives.
					
					 The authors inscribed their books to Kim Jong Suk Library.

articles.title: U.S.- S. Korea Joint Military Drill Slammed by African Body
articles.content:
U.S.- S. Korea Joint Military Drill Slammed by African Body
Pyongyang, March 15 (KCNA) -- The African Regional Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea on Mar. 8 made public a statement in denunciation of the U.S.-south Korea joint military exercises.
					 The statement said that the U.S. started a large-scale nuclear war drills targeting the DPRK by mobilizing huge forces on the Korean peninsula despite the unanimous opposition by the international community, adding:
					
					 The unprecedented drills assume extremely provocative and invasive nature, running diametrically counter to the UN Charter.
					
					 Owing to such ceaseless military provocations by hostile forces as the joint military drills, the DPRK was compelled to take decisive measures for beefing up its defense capabilities.
					
					 The test-fire of ballistic rocket conducted by Hwasong artillery units of the Strategic Force of the Korean People's Army shortly ago is part of exercise of a sovereign state for its just rights for self-defense.
					
					 Consistent is the DPRK's stand on the sovereignty and right to existence of a country and nation, and peace and safety in the region and the rest of the world.
					
					 We condemn the joint military drills and demand the U.S. have deep-thinking over its policy toward the DPRK for regional and global peace.

articles.title: IEAI de la RPDC revela la miserable situacion de derechos humanos de EE.UU.
articles.content:
IEAI de la RPDC revela la miserable situacion de derechos humanos de EE.UU.
Pyongyang, 15 de marzo (ACNC) -- El Instituto de Estudio de los Asuntos Internacionales (IEAI) de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea hizo publica el dia 15 la "carta blanca de derechos humanos de EE.UU. en 2016".
					Segun el documento, fueron las mas costosas de la historia las elecciones presidenciales de EE.UU. de 2016.
					
					En los mismos comicios de 2008 y 2012 costaron alrededor de 5 mil millones de US$ y 6 mil millones de US$, respectivamente, pero el ano pasado, mas de 10 mil millones de US$.
					
					El gasto de anuncio de los candidatos ascendio a 4 mil 400 millones y los ingresos obtenidos por los sitios Web, las estaciones radioemisoras y los periodicos por el concepto de propaganda politica llegaron a mil 200 millones, 916 millones y 882 millones, respectivamente.
					
					En los ultimos anos, el porcentaje de votacion en las elecciones presidenciales y del Congreso de EE.UU. es apenas el 60% y 30-40%.
					
					EE.UU. es la tierra donde no les garantizan a los habitantes ni los derechos elementales del hombre.
					
					Este pais tiene el numero fijo de mas de 7 millones 900 mil desempleados. En una semana de diciembre de 2016 fueron despedidos nuevamente 275 mil estadounidenses y el numero de los desocupados juveniles llega a 18.8%.
					
					No tienen viviendas mas de 560 mil personas y en 17 distritos de la zona nortena, cerca de 322 mil habitantes subsisten a duras penas con la ayuda de las "sociedades beneficas".
					
					Segun los datos publicados en conjunto por los economistas a fines de 2016, el promedio anual de ingresos de los ricos, que ocupan 1% de toda la poblacion estadounidense, es 81 veces del ingreso de las personas de las capas medias e inferiores. Asi se ha incrementado incomparablemente frente a 27 veces de hace 36 anos.
					
					Los gastos de estudios se elevaron 440% durante los ultimos 25 anos.
					
					Debido a los exorbitantes gastos escolares, cerca de 6 millones de jovenes menores de 24 anos no tienen el acceso a la escuela y piden la baja cada ano mas de un millon 200 mil alumnos de las escuelas superiores.
					
					Es indecible la carestia de la asistencia medica de EE.UU.
					
					Hay que pagar 500 dolares para sacar un diente y decenas de miles de dolares para la operacion de apendicitis.
					
					En el caso de tratamiento de urgencia, los gastos de hospitalizacion por dia superan mas de mil dolares y cuando un enfermo se somete a la operacion en la sala de primeros auxilios, debe pagar 100 mil-200 mil dolares.
					
					Por otra parte, el "seguro de medicina" se utiliza como espacio legal para robar el dinero de la gente.
					
					El Departamento de Justicia estadounidense aclaro que desde finales de junio del ano pasado, fueron acusados 301 administradores y medicos de los organos sanitarios, sospechosos de hacer fraude con el seguro de medicina.
					
					Las trabajadoras ocupan 57% de la fuerza laboral, pero reciben como promedio el salario equivalente al 81% de los sueldos de los hombres.
					
					Aunque tienen los mismos oficios, las mujeres afrodescendientes y latinas ganan el 69% y 58% de los sueldos del hombre, respectivamente.
					
					Cada ano, mas de 6 millones de mujeres se convierten en las victimas de violencia.
					
					UPI reporto que en el ano pasado, el trafico de seres humanos se incremento 35.7% en comparacion con 2015 en escala nacional.
					
					Para EE.UU., 2016 fue un ano manchado de sangre derramada por el uso de armas de fuego.
					
					El mismo ano, se reportaron mas de 58 mil 120 casos de uso de armas que dejaron como saldo 15 mil 39 personas muertas y otras 30 mil 589 heridas.
					
					En EE.UU. se practica la discriminacion racial.
					
					De acuerdo con el informe publicado por el grupo de especialistas en el problema de afrodescendientes del Consejo de DDHH de la ONU, el 40.4% de los norteamericanos que vagabundean sin hogares son los afronorteamericanos y la tasa de desempleo de ellos es el doble de la nacional de los blancos. En el caso de los delincuentes, la tasa de encarcelamiento de los afronorteamericanos es 5.9 veces y 2.1 veces mas alta que la de la poblacion blanca en el caso del hombre y la mujer, respectivamente.
					
					Fueron negras la mayoria de 256 personas muertas a tiros de la policia durante 3 meses desde el principio del ano pasado.
					
					Los datos mencionados no pasan de ser una minima parte de los crimenes de violacion de DDHH cometidos en el interior de EE.UU. en 2016. Este hecho es producto inevitable de la "democracia" al estilo norteamericano, basada en la ley de selva y el individualismo extremado.
					
					Aunque EE.UU. critica la situacion de "DDHH" de otros paises hablando del "respeto a los derechos humanos universales" y publicando el "informe anual", no podra ocultar ni negar la deplorable situacion de DDHH de casa.

articles.title: Belicistas surcoreanos libran ejercicios de golpe aereo contra la RPDC
articles.content:
Belicistas surcoreanos libran ejercicios de golpe aereo contra la RPDC
Pyongyang, 15 de marzo (ACNC) -- Segun la cadena surcoreana Yonhap News, los belicistas surcoreanos iniciaron desde el dia 10 el entrenamiento de golpe aereo de gran tamano contra la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, que finalizara el 17.
					En este ejercicio se movilizaron, ademas de numerosos efectivos, mas de 50 aviones de varios tipos pertenecientes a las 15 unidades de las fuerzas aereas surcoreanas incluyendo F-15K, KF-16, FA-50, F-4E, F-5, E-737, CN-235, HH-60, etc.
					
					Y los piratas aereos surcoreanos intentan desarrollar el 16 un entrenamiento de la escuadrilla de ataque de gran envergadura a base de la concepcion de Kill Chain, sistema de ataque preventivo contra la RPDC.
					
					Los belicistas surcoreanos hablan abiertamente que el objetivo del ejercicio es golpear los objetos importantes de la RPDC, diciendo que el simulacro "es para perfeccionar la capacidad de enfrentamiento rapido a la provocacion y revisar la capacidad de golpe a la fuente de provocacion y otros blancos de gran valor".

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun inculpa a EE.UU. y Sur de Corea de vulnerar la paz
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun inculpa a EE.UU. y Sur de Corea de vulnerar la paz
Pyongyang, 15 de marzo (ACNC) -- Los ejercicios militares conjuntos Key Resolve y Foal Eagle significan abierta declaracion de guerra nuclear que intentan desatar EE.UU. y los titeres surcoreanos contra la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea. 
					Senala asi el diario Rodong Sinmun en un articulo individual de este miercoles y continua:
					
					No hay ninguna garantia de que esos simulacros no se haran el detonante de guerra total. 
					
					Evidentemente, ellos aumentan extremadamente el peligro de estallido de la guerra nuclear en la Peninsula Coreana y el resto del Nordeste Asiatico. 
					
					EE.UU. y los traidores surcoreanos son maniacos de guerra nuclear y perturbadores de la paz. 
					
					Seria ilogico que la RPDC se quede con brazos cruzados ante tales circunstancias. 
					
					Mientras que se intensifiquen las maniobras de agresion y de guerra anti-RPDC, se tomaran de modo multiple y sucesivo las contramedidas intransigentes de ella para frustrar con el disuasivo nuclear de justicia las provocaciones de fuerzas hostiles.
					
					Si los imperialistas norteamericanos y los titeres surcoreanos envian un solo obus a la tierra, el mar y el aire jurisdiccionales de la RPDC, los canones Hwasong del Ejercito Popular de Corea devastaran todos los bastiones de agresion y provocacion. Esto no es una advertencia huera. 
					
					EE.UU. y los belicistas surcoreanos deben actuar con prudencia dandose cuenta de la voluntad de los habitantes y militares coreanos de exterminar a los enemigos.

articles.title: Traidores deben sacar lecciones en destino de Park Geun-hye, subraya Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
Traidores deben sacar lecciones en destino de Park Geun-hye, subraya Rodong Sinmun
Pyongyang, 15 de marzo (ACNC) -- El destino deplorable de la traidora surcoreana Park Geun-hye, condenada por la historia y la poblacion, deja una seria leccion junto con el fin tragico de los dictadores fascistas antecedentes del Sur de Corea, segun la cual la horda de traidores no puede mantener la vida a cambio de servilismo a grandes potencias y traiciones y arruinaran inevitablemente los traidores que desafian a la aspiracion y demanda de las masas populares.
					Senala asi el diario Rodong Sinmun en un articulo individual de este miercoles y continua:
					
					Es implacable y horrible el castigo del pueblo a los gobernantes traidores. Y los que dan espaldas a la nacion y adulan a las fuerzas extranjeras se hacen objetos de repudio y rechazo del pueblo y se abandonan por su amo. Lo demuestra el fin tragico de la traidora Park Geun-hye. 
					
					Es inevitable el arruinamiento de los que recurren a la represion fascista contra el pueblo y al enfrentamiento fratricida bajo la ayuda de las fuerzas extranjeras. 
					
					Ahora, los conservadores surcoreanos, que se encuentran en la crisis sin salida por la dimision de Park Geun-hye, hacen esfuerzos desesperados para buscar la salida en la intensificacion de la campana anti-RPDC en confabulacion con las fuerzas extranjeras, pero es una absurdidad que acelera mas su arruinamiento final.
